intro: Hapaline benthamiana, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, daisy-like flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and yellow. The plant is native to southern Africa and thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. It is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
